25. 2FeCI2(s) + CI2(g) 2FeCI3(s) 
The reducing agent in the reaction above is 
A. FeCI2 B. CI2 
C. FeCI3 D. Fe 
26. The reaction that is accompanied by a decrease in 
entropy when carried out constant temperature is 
A. N2O4(g) NO2 
B. N2   + 3H2 2NH3 
C. CaCO3 CaO + CO2 
D. 2N2H4 3N2 + 4H2O 
 
 
27. 32g of anhydrous copper 11 tetraoxosulphate (1V) 
dissolved in 1 dm3 of water generated 13.0kJ of heat. 
The heat of solution is 
A. 26.0 kJ mol-1          B. 65.0kJ mol-1 
C. 130.0kJ mol-1         D. 260.0 kJ mol-1 
 
32. 3CuO(s)  +2NH3(g) 3Cu(s) + 3H2O(1) + N2(g) 
(i) 2NH3(s) + 3CI2(g) 6HCI(s) + N(1) + H2O 
(ii) 4NH3(s) + 3CI2(g) 6H2O(I) + 2N2(g) + HCl 
The reactions represented by the equations above 
demonstrate the 
A. basic properties of ammonia 
B. acidic properties of ammonia 
C. reducing properties of ammonia 
D. oxidizing properties of ammonia. 
 
33. A gas that trun a filter paper previously soaked in 
lead ethanoate solution black is 
A. hydrogen chloride 
B. hydrogen sulphide 
C. sulphur (1V) oxide 
D. sulphur (VI) oxide. 
 
34. A solution containing chloride gives a white precipitate 
with silver trioxonirate (V) solution.

36. The oxide that remains unchanged when heated in 
30. 2X(g) + Y(g) Z(g) 
hydrogen is A. CuO B. Fe2O3 
In the equation above the rate of formation of Z is 
found to be independent of the concentration of Y and 
to quadruple when rate equation for the reaction is 
A. R = k [X][Y] 
B. R= k [X]2[Y] 
C. R = k [X]2[Y]2 
D. R = k [X]2[Y]0 
C. PbO2 D. ZnO

C.               iron D. zinc
